metadata.title: CVE-2024-0565 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds memory read flaw was found in receive_encrypted_standardin fs/smb/client/smb2ops.c in the SMB Client sub-component in the LinuxKernel. This issue occurs due to integer underflow on the memcpy length,leading to a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-97-generic - 5.15.0-97.107
linux-image-5.15.0-97-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-97.107
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-97-generic - 5.15.0-97.107
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-97-generic-64k - 5.15.0-97.107
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1051-kvm - 5.15.0-1051.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1055-aws - 5.15.0-1055.60
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-97.107').
